content:
MetaDataMember Class

Definition

Represents the mapping between a field or a property of a domain object into a column of a database table.

In this Article

public abstract class MetaDataMember
Inheritance
System.Object
MetaDataMember

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Constructors

MetaDataMember()

Initializes a new instance of the MetaDataMember class.

protected MetaDataMember ();

Properties

Association

Gets the MetaAssociation that corresponds to this member.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaAssociation Association { get; }
Value
MetaAssociation

The corresponding MetaAssociation if one exists; otherwise, null.

Remarks

This property represents a database association like a foreign-key to primary-key relationship.

AutoSync

Gets the read-back behavior for this member for insert and update operations.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.AutoSync AutoSync { get; }
Value
AutoSync

An AutoSync enumeration.

CanBeNull

Gets whether the value of this member can be assigned the null value.

public abstract bool CanBeNull { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member can be assigned the null value; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property is dependent on the DbType property, and is provided for convenience.

DbType

Gets the type of the corresponding database column.

public abstract string DbType { get; }
Value
String

The type of the database column as a string.

Remarks

This will be the exact text used to define the column in a Transact-SQL table declaration command. If not so defined, the database column type is inferred from the member type.

DeclaringType

Gets the MetaType that contains this data member.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaType DeclaringType { get; }
Value
MetaType

The meta-type that contains the current member.

DeferredSourceAccessor

Gets the accessor that is used to get and set the deferred source of this member.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaAccessor DeferredSourceAccessor { get; }
Value
MetaAccessor

The accessor used to access the deferred source for this member.

DeferredValueAccessor

Gets the accessor that is used to get and set the deferred value of this member (without causing fetch).

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaAccessor DeferredValueAccessor { get; }
Value
MetaAccessor

The accessor used to access the deferred value for this member.

Expression

Gets the expression that defines a computed column.

public abstract string Expression { get; }
Value
String

The expression for the computed column as a string.

IsAssociation

Gets whether this member defines an association relationship.

public abstract bool IsAssociation { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member defines an association relationship; otherwise, false.

IsDbGenerated

Gets whether this member is automatically generated by the database.

public abstract bool IsDbGenerated { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member is automatically generated by the database; otherwise false.

Remarks

Automatically generated members are synchronized immediately after the corresponding data row is inserted. Insert trigger-generated key values are not supported.

IsDeferred

Gets whether the default behavior is to load this member on a deferred basis.

public abstract bool IsDeferred { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member loaded on a deferred basis by default; otherwise, false.

IsDiscriminator

Gets whether this member represents the inheritance discriminator.

public abstract bool IsDiscriminator { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member represents the inheritance discriminator; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This property can be true for at most one member of the topmost mapped class in a hierarchy.

IsPersistent

Gets whether this member is mapped to a column (or constraint).

public abstract bool IsPersistent { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member is mapped to a column (or constraint); otherwise, false.

Remarks

A class may have a combination of persistent and non-persistent members. Persistent members are mapped while non-persistent members are not mapped. A mapped class must have at least one persistent member.

IsPrimaryKey

Gets whether this member is part of the type's identity.

public abstract bool IsPrimaryKey { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member is part of the type's identity; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If this property is true, the class member represents a column that is part of the table’s unique key. More than one member of the class can have this property set to true for a key that is a composite of the associated columns. For an entity class, at least one member must have this attribute and should be mapped to the primary key or a unique key in the corresponding table or view. Otherwise, LINQ to SQL considers instances of the class as read-only for the purpose of submitting changes to the database.

The set of columns identified with IsPrimaryKey are not required to be the primary key. They simply denote a set that uniquely identifies the entity. Common alternatives include clustering index columns or other unique key columns.

IsVersion

Gets whether this member represents the row version or timestamp.

public abstract bool IsVersion { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if this member represents the row version or timestamp; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Version numbers are incremented and timestamp columns are updated whenever the associated row is updated.

LoadMethod

Gets the DataContext method that is used to perform load operations.

public abstract System.Reflection.MethodInfo LoadMethod { get; }
Value
MethodInfo

The load method as MethodInfo.

MappedName

Gets the name of the column (or constraint) in the database.

public abstract string MappedName { get; }
Value
String

The name of the column (or constraint) as a string.

Member

Gets the underlying MemberInfo.

public abstract System.Reflection.MemberInfo Member { get; }
Value
MemberInfo

Member attribute and metadata information.

MemberAccessor

Gets the accessor that is used to get or set the value of this member.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaAccessor MemberAccessor { get; }
Value
MetaAccessor

The accessor.

Name

Gets the name of the member, same as the MemberInfo name.

public abstract string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name, same as the MemberInfo name.

Ordinal

Gets the ordinal position of this member in the default layout of query results.

public abstract int Ordinal { get; }
Value
Int32

The ordinal position.

StorageAccessor

Gets the accessor that is used to get or set the storage value of this member.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaAccessor StorageAccessor { get; }
Value
MetaAccessor

The accessor for the storage value of this member.

StorageMember

Gets the member that stores the data for this member.

public abstract System.Reflection.MemberInfo StorageMember { get; }
Value
MemberInfo

The storage member.

Type

Gets the type of this member.

public abstract Type Type { get; }
Value
Type

The type of the current member.

UpdateCheck

Gets the optimistic concurrency check policy for this member.

public abstract System.Data.Linq.Mapping.UpdateCheck UpdateCheck { get; }
Value
UpdateCheck

An UpdateCheck enum.

Remarks

If the class does not have a version member (IsVersion set to true), detection is done by comparing original member values with the current database state.

The UpdateCheck property determines how LINQ to SQL implements conflict detection under optimistic concurrency. Only those members with this property set to UpdateCheck or UpdateCheck are considered during conflict detection.

Methods

IsDeclaredBy(MetaType)

Specifies whether this member is declared by the specified type.

public abstract bool IsDeclaredBy (System.Data.Linq.Mapping.MetaType type);
type
MetaType

The type to check.

Returns
Boolean

true if this member is declared by the specified type; otherwise, false.
